questions.question: What primary challenge(s) exist with the traditional web design process?
questions.answer: It takes too long, costs too much, and is too risky
answer_options: It takes too long, costs too much, and is too risky
It is not collaborative enough
It requires too many people
All of the above

questions.question: What are the three stages of Growth-Driven Design?
questions.answer: Strategy, Launch Pad, Continuous Improvement
answer_options: Strategy, Launch Pad, Continuous Improvement
Planning, Development, Testing
Research, Design, Launch
Strategy, Development, Optimization

questions.question: True or false? You can skip the strategy stage and move right to building the launch pad if you have a senior team member who has been working at the company for a while because they will already know what should be built on the website.
questions.answer: False
answer_options: True
False

questions.question: Which statement best describes the purpose of the strategy stage?
questions.answer: To get to know your users, understand their behavior, and drive smart business decisions
answer_options: To get to know your users, understand their behavior, and drive smart business decisions
To create a beautiful website design
To build the website as quickly as possible
To implement the latest web technologies

questions.question: Fill in the blank: The primary goal of the continuous improvement stage is to _______.
questions.answer: improve website performance based on data
answer_options: improve website performance based on data
add more features to the website
redesign the website completely
increase website traffic

questions.question: During the continuous improvement stage, what are the steps used in the cycle?
questions.answer: Collect data, analyze, hypothesize, test
answer_options: Collect data, analyze, hypothesize, test
Plan, build, launch, review
Research, design, develop, deploy
Strategy, implementation, testing, optimization

questions.question: Which of the following factors is NOT important to determine during the website goals step?
questions.answer: What technology to use to build the website
answer_options: What technology to use to build the website
What business goals the website should achieve
Who the target audience is
What success metrics to track

questions.question: Fill in the blank: Growth-Driven Design is a smarter approach to web design that ____________, ____________, and ____________.
questions.answer: eliminates risk, produces better results, shortens time to launch
answer_options: eliminates risk, produces better results, shortens time to launch
costs less, looks better, loads faster
uses new technology, follows trends, impresses users
saves time, reduces effort, increases profits

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT a way to create remarkable content?
questions.answer: Focusing on your business and what you want to promote
answer_options: Focusing on your business and what you want to promote
Creating content that educates your audience
Creating content that entertains your audience
Creating content that inspires your audience

questions.question: What is the difference between Growth-Driven Design and traditional web design?
questions.answer: Growth-Driven Design is a continuous process, while traditional web design is a one-time project
answer_options: Growth-Driven Design is a continuous process, while traditional web design is a one-time project
Growth-Driven Design costs more than traditional web design
Growth-Driven Design requires more people than traditional web design
Growth-Driven Design is only for large companies

questions.question: What is a launch pad website?
questions.answer: A website that is built quickly with the most important elements and is designed to be improved over time
answer_options: A website that is built quickly with the most important elements and is designed to be improved over time
A website that launches your business into space
A website that only contains landing pages
A website that is designed to be replaced every year

questions.question: True or false? You should build your launch pad website to be perfect.
questions.answer: False
answer_options: True
False

questions.question: What is the primary benefit of using Growth-Driven Design over traditional web design?
questions.answer: Faster time to value and reduced risk
answer_options: Faster time to value and reduced risk
Lower cost
Better looking websites
More features

questions.question: In the continuous improvement stage, what should you focus on first?
questions.answer: Pages that have the highest impact on your business goals
answer_options: Pages that have the highest impact on your business goals
Pages that look the worst
Pages that are easiest to fix
Pages that have the most traffic

questions.question: What is a user research method that involves watching users interact with your website?
questions.answer: User testing
answer_options: User testing
Surveys
Analytics
Heat mapping

questions.question: True or false? Growth-Driven Design is only for websites.
questions.answer: False
answer_options: True
False

questions.question: What should you do if your launch pad website isn't performing as expected?
questions.answer: Use data to identify problems and make improvements
answer_options: Use data to identify problems and make improvements
Start over with a completely new design
Add more features
Hire a new designer

questions.question: Which of the following best describes the relationship between Growth-Driven Design and inbound marketing?
questions.answer: Growth-Driven Design supports inbound marketing by creating a website that converts visitors into leads
answer_options: Growth-Driven Design supports inbound marketing by creating a website that converts visitors into leads
Growth-Driven Design replaces inbound marketing
Growth-Driven Design and inbound marketing are completely separate
Growth-Driven Design is a type of inbound marketing

questions.question: What is the main goal of the strategy stage in Growth-Driven Design?
questions.answer: To understand your users and set clear goals for your website
answer_options: To understand your users and set clear goals for your website
To design the perfect website
To build the website as quickly as possible
To choose the best technology

questions.question: True or false? You should always redesign your entire website every few years.
questions.answer: False
answer_options: True
False
